sentences.en: a coup attempt by junior officers
sentences.cn: 低级军官发动的一场军事政变

sentences.en: Aero X coup é concept shown at Geneva two years ago.
sentences.cn: 航空x跑车的概念,显示在日内瓦两年前.

sentences.en: Beating Arsenal was a major coup for the club.
sentences.cn: 击败阿森纳队是该俱乐部的一次重大胜利。

sentences.en: Bill Gates made a great coup to establish Microsoft Company.
sentences.cn: 比尔盖茨20岁时创建了微软公司,他的表现真是一鸣惊人.

sentences.en: Et il lui donna un premier coup de hache.
sentences.cn: 说完,他就向树干砍了过去.

sentences.en: Getting the contract was quite a coup.
sentences.cn: 把合同争取到手是巧妙精彩的一着.

sentences.en: Haiti’s first elected President was deposed in a violent military coup .
sentences.cn: 海地的第一位民选总统在一场动荡的军事政变中被废黜。

sentences.en: He evaded capture after the failed coup .
sentences.cn: 政变失败后他逃脱了抓捕。

sentences.en: He thought that would be a public relation coup.
sentences.cn: 他以为这将是在宣传上高明的一着.

sentences.en: His coup of early this morning had been reported.
sentences.cn: 他今天一清早干的好事已经报案了.

sentences.en: In 1951 Nyuk Tsin engineered her last big coup for the Kee Hui.
sentences.cn: 1951年玉珍又指挥姬氏会办了一件大事.

sentences.en: Irving Kristol delivered the coup de grace in a letter dated June 12: they had decided to reject the proposal.
sentences.cn: 欧文·克里斯托尔在6月12日的一封信中发出了最后一击：他们已经决定驳回该提议。

sentences.en: Le poisson dit à l'eau: " Crois - tu au coup de foudre? "
sentences.cn: 鱼对水说: “ 你相信一见钟情 吗 ? ”

sentences.en: Regency Opera have scored something of a coup by persuading her to undertake the role.
sentences.cn: 雷根希歌剧院说服她扮演这一角色从而取得了巨大成功。

sentences.en: She pulled off a great coup in getting the president to agree to an interview.
sentences.cn: 她竟然办到了让总统同意接受采访.

sentences.en: Side - view: coup é - like roofline and waistline emphasising the sleek elegance of the car.
sentences.cn: 侧面: 双门跑车般的车顶线条与腰围强调汽车的时尚优雅.

sentences.en: The sale is a big coup for the auction house.
sentences.cn: 这笔交易是该拍卖行的一大成功之举。

sentences.en: Winter paused for dramatic effect before delivering the coup de grace.
sentences.cn: 为了增加戏剧性效果,温特停顿了一下,然后才给以致命的一击.

words.tran_cn: 政变；妙计；出乎意料的行动；砰然的一击

phrases.tran_cn: 重计战利品：在印第安人中隆重地重新计数战利品

trans.tran_en: a sudden and sometimes violent attempt by citizens or the army to take control of the government
